name: Treasure Trove
intro: A treasure hunt is one of many different types of games with one or more players who try to find hidden objects or places by following a series of clues. Treasure hunt games may be an indoor or outdoor activity. Outdoors they can be played in a garden or the treasure could be located anywhere around the world.
host: Xavier Institute of Management and Entrepreneurship

levels.title: Dated
levels.text: If 8th May, 2022 is a Sunday, what will 9th May, 2025 be?

levels.title: In 'A' bind
levels.text: If you write the numbers from 1 to 999 in words, how many A-s will you use?

levels.title: Leaping Squares
levels.text: Find the least number that must be added to the number of leap years between 2091 and 2121 to get a perfect square number?

levels.title: The Great Equaliser 1
levels.text: If BEG=YVT, ACE=?

levels.title: Free Wheeling
levels.text: What should replace the question mark?

levels.title: Word Sleuth
levels.text: Locate the given words in the grid, running in one of the eight possible directions horizontally, vertically or diagonally. There will be exactly one unused word. Which word is it? XAVIERS, ECONOMICS, SOCIETY, CONFLUENCE, TREASURE, TROVE, PRICE, DEMAND, MONEY, SUPPLY, RICH, POOR

levels.title: Missing Number
levels.text: Which number should replace the question mark?

levels.title: Ant Hike
levels.text: An ant has to climb up 200 m. It moves up at a speed of 2 m/min. But after every 5 min it gets tired and rests for 2 min. While resting the ant comes down at the speed of 1 m/min. Calculate the time required (in min) by the ant to reach the height of 200 m.

levels.title: Sequence 3
levels.text: What next? 1,1,2,3,5,?

levels.title: Trinception
levels.text: How many triangles are there in the figure?

levels.title: Sequence 4
levels.text: What next? B, D, H, AF, ?

levels.title: Straw Math
levels.text: Move one of the lines to make it valid. All lines are in different colour. Write the colour of the line to be moved in the answer: Black, blue, red, green, orange, yellow, purple, gray, pink, dashed.

levels.title: Painter's Bill
levels.text: There is a wall of dimension 88x154. The wall has to be painted. A painter charges Rs. 5000 for painting a square shaped figure(however large). At what minimum cost can the wall be painted?

levels.title: Image Sleuth
levels.text: Decipher the following:

levels.title: Tally
levels.text: Write a digit from 1-9 in each cell(without repetition) so that the numbers outside represent the sum of numbers in corresponding row/column

levels.title: Unscramble Scramble
levels.text: Unscramble each word to form a meaningful sentence: UOY NNAOTC AKET UTO RTEUSAER RMOF ETH OSEUH FO NOMCOEMISTS OS SLEIAY

choices: YOU CANNOT TAKE OUT TREASURE FROM THE HOUSE OF ECONOMISTS SO EASILY

levels.title: The Great Equaliser 2
levels.text: If YTRSDITR=TREASURE, FSBOF TOVSTFP=?

levels.title: Timing Angles
levels.text: What is the angle(in degrees) between hour-hand and minute-hand at 6:30 am?

levels.title: Symbol Math
levels.text: What is the value of △ if △, ◯ and ▢ represent three distinct natural numbers and the following hold true: △² + ◯² =  ▢, | △ - ◯ | = 2 and (△/2) + (◯/3) = △

levels.title: Spiritual Offering
levels.text: There are 7 temples surrounding a pond. The pond has a special feature that if you immerse any number of flowers in it, they get doubled. You want to offer equal number of flowers at each temple. Before visiting each temple you go to the pond and double your flowers(even before visiting the first temple). How many minimum number of flowers should you carry so that this is done?(No flower should be left after visiting 7th temple)

levels.title: Sudoku
levels.text: Place a number from 1-9 in each empty cell so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. Answer format: Write the digits in the row marked with K (from left to right) followed by a comma and the digits in column marked L (from top to bottom). For eg. 123456789,123456789

levels.title: Love Thy Neighbour
levels.text: 6 friends - U, V, W, X , Y & Z stay one in each of the rooms(A, B, C, D, E & F) in the figure. Two friends are neighbors if their rooms touch each other. Who stays in room E if the following statements are true: V and Z have equal number of neighbors. W has 2 less neighbors than U. U and V are not neighbors to X. V’s room is smaller than that of Z.

levels.title: Censored
levels.text: Form a 4-digit number (using all different digits) using the following clues. A shaded dot means a correct digit in correct position and an unshaded dot means a correct digit in incorrect position.
